entries.title: FTX founder pleads not guilty to fraud
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried pleaded not guilty in Manhattan federal court, Tuesday, to charges that he cheated investors and looted customer deposits on his cryptocurrency trading platform as a judge set a tentative trial date for October.

entries.title: French Minister Sébastien Lecornu pledges France's continued support for Lebanese armed forces
entries.description: Visiting Lebanon, the armed forces minister spent New Year's Eve with French soldiers of the United Nations Interim Force and called to shed light on the death of an Irish peacekeeper on December 14, 2022.

entries.title: Ukraine's rail battle: 'Our tanks go in first, then our trains'
entries.description: The national railway company, a legacy of the Soviet era, was long criticized for its endemic corruption and inability to reform. With the war, everything has changed. The railway employees are on the front line and the train is more essential than ever.

entries.title: Republican McCarthy falls short in first round of voting for House speaker
entries.description: California Republican Kevin McCarthy made history for the wrong reasons on Tuesday, he is the first person in a century to lose the vote for speaker in the first round.

entries.title: In India, Kerala's leaders mix tropical communism with religion to appeal to the Hindu electorate
entries.description: The most socially advanced state in the country is the last left-wing stronghold in the Indian Federation. And the ruling Communist Party isn't being idle in the face of the Hindu nationalism that rules in New Delhi.

entries.title: Paris 2024 Olympics: How will security be managed for this unprecedented event?
entries.description: Controlling the opening ceremony on the Seine, reducing crime, protecting public and sports sites: Every aspect of the security strategy for the Paris Olympics has not yet been decided.

entries.title: The al-Fashaga triangle, a powder keg on the Sudanese-Ethiopian border
entries.description: Khartoum took advantage of the war in Tigray to reclaim much of the historically disputed territory and allow its farmers to return to its fertile land.

entries.title: Thousands of Kurds travel to Paris for the funerals of three victims killed in shooting attack
entries.description: Tears mixed with anger at the funerals of the three members of the Kurdish community killed in a racist attack in Paris on December 23.

entries.title: French audiences are returning to the movies faster than their European neighbors
entries.description: With 152 million admissions in 2022, France's movie theaters have returned to nearly three-quarters of their pre-Covid-19 attendance.

entries.title: Pension reform: French PM wants to appear open to dialogue with unions
entries.description: Postponing the legal retirement age to 65 is 'is not set in stone,' said Elisabeth Borne on Tuesday, before continuing discussions with unions and employers.

entries.title: 'Gas prices are back at levels seen before the war in Ukraine'
entries.description: Despite using less gas than anticipated over a very mild fall-winter of 2022, China's abandonment of its zero-Covid policy has boosted demand, writes columnist Philippe Escande.

entries.title: Brazil's President Lula pays final farewell to 'King' Pelé
entries.description: The new president was visibly emotional as he paid tribute to the football legend who was the only player ever to win three World Cups.

entries.title: EU offers Covid-19 vaccines to China as infections surge
entries.description: China on Tuesday condemned new Covid test requirements by around a dozen countries on passengers traveling abroad from its territory, warning it could take 'countermeasures' in response.

entries.title: The changing landscape of France's real estate market
entries.description: According to one of France's leading real estate agencies, 2022 real estate market figures show that, in Paris, the market has changed as more people want to work from home.

entries.title: 28 bodies found in Burkina Faso, volunteer militia blamed
entries.description: The escalating toll among the army, police and civilian forces unleashed two military coups last year, launched by officers angered at failures to stem the bloodshed.

entries.title: UK trains disrupted again as workers stage fresh strikes
entries.description: Rail workers say wages have failed to keep pace with the skyrocketing cost of living. Inflation in the UK has soared to a 41-year high of 11.1%.

entries.title: Far-right Israeli minister makes provocative visit to Al-Aqsa mosque compound
entries.description: Hamas described Minister of National Security Itamar Ben-Gvir's trip to the disputed landmark as crossing a 'red line.'

entries.title: NFL player Damar Hamlin in critical condition after suffering cardiac arrest
entries.description: During Monday's game, the Buffalo Bills player received medical attention for more than 30 minutes on the field before being taken to a hospital.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: What if the key to the crisis was in the Middle East?
entries.description: The alliance between Russia and Iran needs to be weakened in Syria, which would give Israel and Turkey leeway in Ukraine and hasten the end of the war there.

entries.title: 'Who could have predicted the climate crisis?': Macron slammed on climate change remark
entries.description: During his New Year's Eve address to the French public, the French president suggested the climate crisis was unpredictable, causing an outcry from scientists and members of the opposition.

entries.title: French PM says retirement age increase to 65 'is not set in stone'
entries.description: Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne said the government is preparing to be flexible to reach its goal of balancing the pensions system by 2030.

entries.title: Beijing lambasts 'unacceptable' Covid rules for travelers from China
entries.description: The United States, Canada, France and Japan are among a number of countries now requiring travelers from China to show a negative Covid test before arrival.

entries.title: Pelé: Thousands of fans flock to Santos for his wake
entries.description: On Monday, January 2, the coffin of the football legend was placed in the stadium of FC Santos, his former club, for 24 hours.

entries.title: Burkina Faso junta demands new French ambassador
entries.description: An ongoing diplomatic spat between Paris and Ouagadougou echoes France's dispute with Mali against a backdrop of political instability and a growing jihadist threat.

entries.title: Aminata Traoré: 'In Mali, this anger toward France is the painful expression of feeling humiliated'
entries.description: 'From Dakar to Djibouti, a tour of the Africa-France relationship' (4/11). A former minister of culture, the anti-globalization activist deciphers the failures of development policies, particularly in the Sahel.

entries.title: France hesitates on public transport competition, as service deteriorates
entries.description: 250 representatives from the Paris region signed an open letter to Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne asking for an end to the process of opening to competition in the region's transport system.

entries.title: Airbus positions itself to take a stake in Atos' cybersecurity business
entries.description: The aircraft manufacturer is ready to take a minority stake in Evidian, which is also of interest to Thales.

entries.title: Sweden, rich in natural resources, struggles to become a 'mining nation'
entries.description: Sweden is a leading producer of iron ore and base metals in the European Union, its subsoils rich in critical raw materials. But bureaucracy and opposition from local residents are delaying projects.

entries.title: Earth, Wind & Fire drummer Fred White dies at 67
entries.description: His family and former group announced his passing on Monday. The musician went on to win six Grammy awards with the funk band, founded in 1969 by his brother, the late Maurice White.

entries.title: In Montpellier, the MoCo explores the history of museums in exile
entries.description: Three collections are studied: the Palestinian National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, the Museum of Solidarity Salvador Allende and the Ars Aevi Museum of Contemporary Art in Sarajevo.

entries.title: Death of Mahsa Amini: 'The only way to end the crisis in Iran is to end the intervention of clerics in politics'
entries.description: The morality police, whose role is to ensure compliance with the guidelines of Islam, is not among the foundations of the dogma of Islam, says the philosopher and Islamologist Razika Adnani in an op-ed in 'Le Monde.'
